The last-minute fight to save Gaza's ancient archaeological treasures
subhead: Amid the vast destruction of the war, a small group of determined individuals fought to save Gaza's archaeological heritage. On September 10, they secured a few hours' reprieve from the Israeli army before a storage depot filled with artifacts was bombed to perform a delicate evacuation – the result of intense, high-level negotiations.

Pope's visit to Lebanon brings 'breath of fresh air' for a country under military and political pressure
subhead: While the papal trip is unlikely to change the balance of power, Vatican diplomacy is expected to reaffirm its commitment to Lebanon's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

title: Hong Kong apartment fire death toll rises to 146
subhead: More than 1,000 people from across the city flocked to the housing complex in Hong Kong's northern Tai Po district to pay their respects on Sunday. Authorities have set up a task force to look into the cause of the blaze.

title: Kikuo Ibe's quest to build the unbreakable watch
subhead: Forty-two years after inventing the first indestructible watch, the Casio G-Shock, the Japanese engineer continues to inspire. As part of a European tour, he stopped in France to meet his fans.

title: 'Dédé la Sardine' and Russian oil: Inside the affair that has haunted Total for 15 years
subhead: Seven people have been ordered to stand trial for their involvement in an arbitration process that was allegedly manipulated in order to extract the equivalent of €16 billion from French oil company Total. Their trial begins on Monday.

subhead: From talking about intimacy at home to learning about consent and exploring equality in relationships, the central city of Angoulême is fostering dialogue with residents in socio-economic difficulty.

title: Resignation of Andriy Yermak, Zelensky's right-hand man, shocks Ukrainian politics
subhead: The all-powerful head of the presidential administration was deeply unpopular in Ukraine. Yet his departure comes at the worst time, as Kyiv faces mounting pressure from the US to strike a peace deal with Russia.

title: China's invisible workforce powering the platform economy
subhead: Service, delivery and mobility apps are shaping China's new economy. In a society with minimal safety nets, they promise frontline workers higher incomes, at the price of long hours and extreme physical effort.
